docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Congressional investigators have found that more than half of the new drugs approved for marketing in this country have some severe or fatal side effects not found in testing, or not reported until years after the medications have been widely used.

headline.main: Dangers of Some New Drugs Go Undetected, Study Says

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: ''Non'' is more than a prefix. It has become a life style.

headline.main: Words to Survive Life With: None of This, None of That

docs.snippet: LEAD: ''Non'' is more than a prefix. It has become a life style.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: On Dixwell Avenue, where addicts have congregated for years to buy and sell drugs, health workers are poised to begin giving users new needles for old ones as a way to try to slow the spread of AIDS.

headline.main: New Haven Plans to Give Drug Addicts New Needles

byline.original: By KIRK JOHNSON, Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The word is ''neoprohibitionism,'' and when those who make their living or take pleasure in food and wine say it they see red.
